abstract: A Boolean value that indicates whether the cell is highlighted.
overview:
## Discussion

The highlighting affects the appearance of labels, image, and background. When the highlighted state of a cell is set to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], labels are drawn in their highlighted text color (default is white). The default value is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false]. If you set the highlighted state to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] through this property, the transition to the new state appearance is not animated. For animated highlighted-state transitions, see the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewCell/setHighlighted(_:animated:)] method.

Note that for highlighting to work properly, you must fetch the cell’s labels using the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewCell/textLabel] and [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewCell/detailTextLabel] properties and set each label’s [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UILabel/highlightedTextColor] property; for images, get the cell’s image using the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewCell/imageView] property and set the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIImageView] object’s `highlightedImage` property.

# isHighlighted

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether the cell is highlighted.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var isHighlighted: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

The highlighting affects the appearance of labels, image, and background. When the highlighted state of a cell is set to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], labels are drawn in their highlighted text color (default is white). The default value is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false]. If you set the highlighted state to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] through this property, the transition to the new state appearance is not animated. For animated highlighted-state transitions, see the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewCell/setHighlighted(_:animated:)] method.

Note that for highlighting to work properly, you must fetch the cell’s labels using the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewCell/textLabel] and [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewCell/detailTextLabel] properties and set each label’s [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UILabel/highlightedTextColor] property; for images, get the cell’s image using the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewCell/imageView] property and set the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIImageView] object’s `highlightedImage` property.

## Managing cell selection and highlighting

- **selectionStyle**: The style of selection for a cell.
- **UITableViewCell.SelectionStyle**: The style of selected cells.
- **isSelected**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the cell is selected.
- **setSelected(_:animated:)**: Sets the selected state of the cell, optionally animating the transition between states.
- **setHighlighted(_:animated:)**: Sets the highlighted state of the cell, optionally animating the transition between states.
